October 2, 1952
Hr. Frank Schooley
Radio Station WILL
Gregory Hall
University of Illinois
Urbana, Illinois
wear Frank:
lour very kind letter and card of October 1 and the sentiments
therein are deeply appreciated.
As to my interest in the Executive Director’s job of HAEB my
answer is still the seme. I am not interested at this time or in
the forseeable future# If the University of Alabama does not pro¬
ceed with its TV plans, I ©hall consider moving to an institution
where they are proceeding with TV, but I shall stay here and fight
it through if it possible to do so. job here does not pay well
and I have turned down several nice offers for the reasons that:
first, I like to live in the deep South; second, I have put a great
deal of myself into this present job and am reluctant to leave this
state; third, ay work here is personally more gratifying and offers
opportunity for advancement so long as I continue to butt my head
against the obstacles we face. Furthermore, if I do make a move,
I want it to be my last move. I am a strong believer in deeply*-
planted roots. This job has never paid well and never will pay
well so I pay a high price for the privilege of living where I
want to live and doing what I want to do. If I should mates a
move out of the deep South, I can think of no place I had rather
be ad no group of people with w’nom I had rather work than you.
Will, Bob and the other fine people I have met at the University
of Illinois. The fact remains, however, that leaving here is. not
a probability that I face at the present time. How soon I may
face that probability, I can’t say.
I apologize for such a long paroration, but your kindness
I felt prompted a rather complete reply; so unless you cone up
with some highly negative information concerning Wynn - and I
doubt that you will - 1 am calling a meeting which will include
Si, Dick Hull, Burton Paulu, Wilbur, and me with Earl Wynn in
Washington the evening of October 16 and the rooming of October
17th for a complete discussion of the possibilities of his going
to work with us the first of January. I am convinced that he
will do a thoroughly outstanding job if we can arrive at an
agreement.
